title: Hinting Advice ?
content:
I'm looking for some advice, tutorial, or methods for hinting.

I'm producing Post Script Opentype fonts and using this process at the moment to hint.

1. Set the Alignment Zones - Not using auto zones which doesn't seem to do a great job.  
2. Auto Hint the fonts with either FontLabs Auto Hinting or Adobe's AFDKO - I've tried both to compare results. I then adjust hints that don't seem to work.  
3. Set the Standard Stems - Again not using auto stems but the method described [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203081048/http:/scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site_id=nrsi&item_id=NotesOnHintingWithFL)

After using this process and changing lots of different parameters I'm still getting hints that don't seem to be working.

This image shows the Sub/Superscript, the Superscript on the right is jumping all over the place at small sizes.

Is there anything else I can try to improve the hinting ?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203081048im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sub_6709.png)
author: RachelR

comments.content: Have you checked your bottom alignment zone for the superscripts? Remember that bottom alignment zones belong in 'Secondary zones'.
Yes the bottom alignment zones where set correctly in the Secondary Zones field
Screencap of your zones in glyph window?

Rachel

Some of your glyph hints maybe overlaping some blue zones (perhaps the x height blue zone?). I would be happy to look at your vfb file if you like.
